result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason L Jophlin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: On Count #1, the Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $100 + costs = $379 + $200 DNA Surcharge = $579 + $50 drug testing fees + $94.50 drug abuse surcharge + $33 subpoena fees = $756.50; due in $100 incriments per month, beginning 10/31/14 and on the last day of the month until paid in full. Non-payment results in a 31 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jason L Jophlin

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Failure to pay attorney fees shall result in a jail sentence of 12 days c/s.  Entry of a Civil judgment.
Order for payment of Atty. Fees in the amount of $286.90 to Atty. Zarwell
For payment of Attorney fees - Mr. Jophlin is liable for court appointed attorney fees.  Attorney fees shall be added to the payment plan ordered on 09/24/2014.
Petition for payment of attorney fees with cover letter
* FINANCIAL RECORDS *
With elements and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

Case called at 1:21 pm [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for STC)
[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Jason L Jophlin in court with Attorney David Zarwell. DA Susan V. Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
On Motion of the State, the Court amends Count #1 to Possession of THC, contrary to 961.41(3g)(e), a misdemeanor
On Motion of the State, the Court strikes the on or near a school enhancer on Count #1

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count#2

On Count #1, the Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $100 + costs = $379 + $200 DNA Surcharge = $579 + $50 drug testing fees + $94.50 drug abuse surcharge + $33 subpoena fees = $756.50; due in $100 incriments per month, beginning 10/31/14 and on the last day of the month until paid in full. Non-payment results in a 31 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive.

No driver license revocation
Recess: 1:31 pm
Status conference on September 19, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
Pre-trial conference on August 27, 2014 at 01:40 pm.
Scheduling Notice

* FINANCIAL RECORDS *
Scheduling Notice

Case called at 10:51 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Jason L Jophlin in court. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court reviews case file documents, indicates that Mr. Jophlin did not qualify for SPD & Court did not find him eligible for Court appointed counsel
Mr. Jophlin indicates that he has contacted counsel, but they all want too much money for retainer

Court has colloquy with Mr. Jophlin re: employment/finances
Court presents basis and Appoints Attorney David Zarwell and orders Mr. Jophlin to reminburse Attorney fees at the rate of $75/month beginning 8/15/14 and on the 15th day of the month thereafter until paid in full. 
Court tolls the time for preliminary hearing

Court requires a $1000 signature bond, with no special conditions:
-Booking at JCSD

NEXT: (1) Schedule Adjourned Initial Appearance 8/8/14 at 10:00 am -  Send notices **ADDRESS TIME LIMITS**
State Public Defender Determination of Financial Eligibility - Defendant not eligible.
Court denies the Defendant's Petition for Appointment of Counsel- Person lists no expenses
with attached State Public Defender Determination of Financial Eligibility - Defendant not eligible.
